name: Watertown Hotel Seattle

reviews.text: We stayed four nights at the Watertown and were extremely happy with our spacious room. It had a comfortable king bed, robes, Aveda products, a safe, an iron and ironing board, a wireless connection, Starbucks coffee and a cable TV. Our room faced the street, but we heard no traffic noise. We did hear
reviews.title: Great comfort in the University District

likes.disliked: — Difficult to find a place to sit at breakfast

reviews.text: occasional footsteps above us, however. The cleaning staff did an excellent job daily and the place was immaculate.
reviews.title: Outstanding choice for Seattle Wa

likes.liked: — Value, rooms, happy hour, shuttle, breakfast

reviews.text: The hotel has friendly, upbeat staff, who are happy to answer questions. On weekends, freshly baked chocolate chip cookies (the aroma fills the lobby) wait for guests at reception in the afternoon and a big bowl of apples is available. A Happy Hour (free wine and beer plus snacks) starts at 5:30 p.m. on weekdays.
reviews.title: Modern comfort and style
Infrickincredible!
reviews.text: A small gym is located on the main floor near the breakfast room.

The morning buffet includes fresh fruit, such as sliced oranges, honeydew melon and bananas; three kinds of cereal; baked goods, such as bagels, muffins and small scones; scrambled eggs and bacon or sausage; two kinds of juice; 2 percent and skimmed milk; and coffee and tea. The room is too small, though, to comfortably fit the number of guests who often arrive at the same time. On warm days, it is possible to go to tables outside, but Seattle is rarely warm early in the morning.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Watertown! Felt like I was back in University!
Wonderful Service
reviews.text: The Watertown provided excellent service for our stay. Karen was especially helpful and a joy to interact with! Make use of the shuttle, the free breakfast, the "a la carte" ammenity, and the free bicycles. The more we talked to the staff, the better our stay became.
Patricia, Lake Charles, Louisiana
reviews.title: nice offerings but pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: greeted by friendly/helpful evening staff (great recommendation for dinner). Free underground/secure parking was bonus. Room was clean, comfortable with nice touches of alcohol pads by phone/remote, filtered tap water, micro, fridge & safe, robes for lounging (though not worth the $75 they were selling them for), cozy bed/pillows. Arrived late in evening so didn't partake of "ala carte" carts. The shower was decent...head high enough so my kind of tall husband didn't have to crouch, rounded curtain rod but shower/toilet area small to begin with, could have had more/larger towels available, Aveda products. Large sink/counter area but could have used the space to make shower/tub/hotel larger...especially in a suite room. No phone by bed, alarm clock complicated but not utilizing wake up call or alarm so didn't care too much.
reviews.title: Nice room, ok location

likes.disliked: — location isn't really near anything interesting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast & eating area was decent. I've had better buffets (no waffles) but lots of healthy choices. No highchair so eating w/ toddler challenging and no car seat available for us to utilize complimentary shuttle to shopping.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

likes.liked: — Large room with fab city view

reviews.text: Unfortunately fire alarm went off @ 6:45 AM (toaster in kitchen). Did try to extend stay and negotiate lower rate since we would have to change room. Morning desk staff not quite as helpful/friendly. No discount offered even w/ alarm snafu.
reviews.title: Outstanding service and quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow. What a fabulous hotel. They even write to you if you fill in a comment card to thank you. You have to stay here.Do not hesitate. I could not fault a thing. Now this is really important. You MUST go to the Italian Restaurant Mama Melina just up the road. You MUST try the meatballs and spaghetti and the Risotto. We ate there both nights we were at Watertown. The staff will direct you, no more than 5 minutes walk. Bring expandable trousers and be prepared for a wonderful meal!
reviews.title: You have to try this

reviews.text: What can be better than to be greeted w/ a plate of warm cookies? I don't know of much. We arrived shortly after 3pm and were quickly checked into our spacious room. We were headed to Tacoma to go to the Museum of Glass. We told the girl at the front desk, Jessica, on our way up where we wanted to go and by the time we got down, she had a map for us and instructions on how to get there.
reviews.title: Greeted w/ Warm Cookies!

likes.liked: — The cookies and the great mirror

reviews.text: They have a lovely shuttle service as the hotel is not right downtown. They were very accommodating and were always on time to pick us up.
reviews.title: unique is right !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were very comfortable, which is always important.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: I enjoyed this hotel and would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Watertown Hotel -- A Great Choice For UW and Seattle Area Visit

reviews.text: Good free breakfast, quiet, awesome big rooms, wonderful free shuttle, safe with key card access in elevator, very helpful staff. I wish they had this hotel in every city I visit.
reviews.title: Beyond Expectations

reviews.text: Fabulous staff! Beautiful imaculate rooms and all of the little amenities made it a memoable stay. Watertown has raised my expectations for other hotels.
reviews.title: Great attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was spending 4 days in Seattle in August and based on trip advisor reviews we chose the Watertown which was a great choice. The staff at this hotel goes out of their way to assist you with everything. I was traveling out to Seattle by Amtrak and was arriving early in the day. They were able to arrange an early check-in which was really appreciated after spending 2 days on a train! I took advantage of several of their "carts" while there ...it was great to have a computer in your room...had problems with the printer working but I was able to print my return trip boarding pass at their computer at the front desk with no problems. The breakfast is great...not your typical dry breakfast buffet...they did have all the usual suspects...i.e. granola, bagels, etc...but they always had scrambled eggs and some type of breakfast meat every day. There is coffee and tea available all day long long with a short wine tasting in the late afternoon. They also have a free washer and dryer available for guest use. Another big plus. We chose a corner suite which was absolutely great...very roomy and comfortable. If I had to be picky and find something to fault them I would say their housekeeping could use a little help..there were stains on the couch and the comforter....I had to flag down a housecleaner to vacuum my room ...the same piece of string had been sitting on the floor for 2 days so I know they hadn't vacuumed . But overall my experience here was very good and I would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great staff
Staff is tops!
reviews.text: I was scheduled for knee replacement surgery on July 28th at the UW Surgical Center. Since we are from Portland, the surgeon stipulated that we would have to remain in the Seattle area for no less than 10 days after the surgery (infection etc.)

The Watertown Hotel was listed on the UW Housing options sheet for people needing a place to stay before and after the release from the hospital. After checking it out on the web, I booked a "board room". My wife and I checked in on July 27th and stayed for 10 days, departing on August 6th.
reviews.title: Just try it! You'll love it!

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, great service, pretty good bargain.

description: Within easy walking distance to UW campus. Local shuttle to downtown Seattle and area attractions. Our goal is to provide our guests with legendary service. Loaner bicycles available to our guests. Join us from 3pm - 7pm in the lobby for complimentary Starbuck's coffee and our signature pineapple cupcakes.
